title: Boy, 11, fatally shoots sister, 10, while playing when mother leaves them home alone with loaded gun
text:
A South Carolina mother was arrested after her 11-year-old son fatally shot his 10-year-old sister as they played with a gun while they were left home alone.

Police said Bernadette Renae Owens, 30, of Hanahan, South Carolina, was arrested and charged with two counts of unlawful conduct toward a child, according to The Post and Courier

Authorities said Owens had left the children alone on the night of October 5 in their unfurnished home. The loaded handgun was said to have been in a laundry basket on Owens' bedroom floor.

Bernadette Renae Owens, 30 (left), was arrested after her 11-year-old son accidentally, fatally shot his sister, Cabriya Lucas, 10, when Owen left the kids home alone with a loaded gun

Investigators said in their affidavit, obtained by WCIV, that they found the home in disarray and that dog feces and urine was on the floors. Food and drinks were also said to have been found scattered throughout the kitchen and children's bedroom.

Hanahan police said the children were playing with the gun when the girl, Cabriya Lucas, 10, was shot. She died before police arrived at the home around 10pm.

Investigators then determined that Cabriya had been accidentally shot by her brother.

During a press briefing Wednesday, Hanahan Police Department Chief Dennis Turner said they will not be pursing charges against the 11-year-old boy because the incident was ruled an accident, according to WCBD.

Police said that Owens left the two children alone in this unfurnished home. The loaded gun was said to have been left in a laundry basket where the children found it

Owens was arrested October 9 and charged with unlawful conduct toward a child because 'she left the children alone inside the residence and left a loaded firearm that was easily accessible by the children,' Turner said.

Turner said the 'very tragic incident' was one of the hardest investigations that he had worked on during his more than 20-year police career.

'Lives have been forever a changed because of this, and essentially because of a senseless act — because of irresponsibility,' Turner said.

Authorities said they delayed arresting Owens until their investigation was complete.

She was released from custody after posting $80,000 bail. If convicted, she faces up to 10 years in prison for each charge.

Police declined to say whether the boy is still in his mother's care.

Authorities did not release the boy's name.
description: Police said Bernadette Renae Owens, 30 (left), of South Carolina, was charged with two counts of unlawful conduct toward a child following the incident which left Cabriya Lucas (right), 10, dead.
